# Init
```{python}
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

sns.get_dataset_names()
iris = sns.load_dataset('iris')

```


# Setting figure sizes
## Matplotlib
```{python}
plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = [12, 5]
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
ax.set_xlabel('Sepal length')
ax.set_ylabel('Sepal width')
ax.set_title('Iris dataset')
ax.scatter(iris['sepal_length'], iris['sepal_width'])
plt.show()
```

## Seaborn
```{python}
#| fig-align: center
g = sns.FacetGrid(iris, col = 'species', col_wrap = 1, height = 2, aspect = 2)
g = g.map(plt.scatter, 'sepal_length', 'sepal_width')
plt.show()
plt.close()
```

# Seaborn examples
```{python}
#| fig-align: center
plt.figure(figsize=(6,6))
g = sns.scatterplot(data = iris, 
                    x = 'sepal_length', 
                    y = 'petal_width', 
                    hue = 'species')
plt.show()
plt.close()
```

# Plotly examples
```{python}
#| fig-width: 3
#| fig-align: center
# x and y given as array_like objects
import plotly.express as px
fig = px.scatter(x=[0, 1, 2, 3, 4], y=[0, 1, 4, 9, 25], width = 800, height = 800)
fig.show()
```
